pageContext.claim: “We reduced average premiums on the federal Obamacare exchanges for the first time in the history of the horrible Obamacare.”
pageContext.analysis: Average premiums did decrease for the first time in 2019 but it’s mostly because insurers have finally figured out this new market and the insurers who were really struggling have withdrawn. Roughly the same outcomes were expected if Obama administration policies had remained in place. Trump administration officials have claimed that some incremental/technical changes to the marketplaces have made a difference but Republicans have also undermined the Obamacare markets with  counteracting actions such as repealing the individual mandate and expanding alternatives that are drawing people out of the marketplaces.
